entry.title: How to catch a bat
entry.summary:
Author: VHdeadinside

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,521Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 81

Summary: In a world where Batman never revealed his identity and everyone remains ignorant in the league, even though all the Robins are around and clearly the younger ones know who Batman is, Batman gets spotted leaving Wayne Manor and is apparently dating Bruce. Naturally this breaks poor Clark Kent's heart but all he can do is move on so long as Batman is happy. Except for the fact that Batman is never happy unless Superman is near him, so the idea of Clark suddenly dating men drive Batman insane, all the while Clark is nursing a poor broken heart with the support of the original league.

entry.title: New Days
entry.summary:
Author: Andria_Wei_Lan_Choi

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,965Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 37

Summary: Clark heard the signal as soon as they landed. He’d been on a mission to another planet with Hal, but Bruce’s distress call—meant for the Batkids—cut through the static like a scream.The explosion rocked the area right as he got there. The building collapsed like a house of cards, fire licking the edges. Then he heard it—a heartbeat. Weak. Unsteady. But unmistakably Bruce’s.He punched through concrete, fire curling off his shoulders, and found Bruce half-buried and unfocused. Clark’s breath caught as he pulled him free and flew him to the med bay. - excerpt

entry.title: Meeting Again
entry.summary:
Author: lonely_dream_walker

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,367Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 89

Summary: Clark Kent is a journalist who has recently moved from Metropolis to Gotham. He has just been given the task of interviewing the multibillionaire Bruce Wayne who, unbeknownst to him, is the superhero Batman. Although this job appears simple, it quickly becomes more difficult as Clark, in his Superman persona, must conceal his hero identity from Bruce while trying to protect Gotham from a mysterious and dangerous enemy.

entry.title: you know that i love you
entry.summary:
Author: qtchocolate

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 567Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 65

Summary: “Could you…”, Bruce pauses looking at Clark, his hair still dripping wet from his shower. He’s holding a towel, but making no move to stop the pitter patter of wetness on the carpet– Alfred would be disappointed, Clark knows.In a silent question, Clark raises his eyebrows. Bruce sighs, before stepping closer.He’s wearing boxers with an overworn t-shirt, and Clark is decidedly not trying his best to not look down. Not that it’s working, but a man can try.--clark dries bruce's hair.

entry.title: Blasphemous Rumors
entry.summary:
Author: Fluffmonster69

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,618Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 23

Summary: Inspired by the events of Batman: Gotham By Gaslight (1989) Bruce Wayne is on trial, believed to be Jack the Ripper after the serial murders follow him from London to Gotham. Clark Kent is sent to report on the trial and the week leading to Bruce's execution. He is unnerved by Bruce, who's appearance and demeanor have drastically changed, however upon arriving back in Gotham a day after the trial Clark is greeted with the city in uproar. Bruce Wayne has escaped his imprisonment and criminals start cropping up half dead covered in identical puncture wounds. Clark sets out to find Bruce as Superman, finding instead a monster lurking in the shadows of Gotham's streets.*Tags and warnings may change.Updates once a week :)

entry.title: Where the Birds Used to Sing
entry.summary:
Author: That_One_Computer_Geek (T1CG)

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,029Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 102

Summary: “You’re the Batman,” Clark said, trying to keep his voice warm, even. “I’ve heard about you.” Still no response. The wings shifted slightly, the sound low and dry, like wind moving through bone. Even folded, they loomed. Easily twelve, maybe fourteen feet in total wingspan. The joints flexed with subtle micromovements, like the Bat was resisting the urge to spring forward or flee. And the texture… rough, almost scaly, with no sign of feathers. All tendon and membrane. Like something prehistoric. Clark felt a shiver crawl down his spine. It wasn’t fear. Not exactly. “I’ve been looking for you,” he said, taking a cautious step forward, hands open at his sides. “Not you you, I mean. Others like me. Metas. People doing the right thing on their own terms.” No answer. “I thought you’d be taller,” he added, offering a small grin. Nothing. Not even a twitch. “Or… less grim.” Or, Bruce's time over the years, gaining children, loosing them, joining the JL, all while the JL is under the impression that the man in the batsuit is some sort of cryptid.
